newsitem.title: USA: Richmond Savings Bank conversion approved.
newsitem.headline: Richmond Savings Bank conversion approved.

text.p: Richmond Savings Bank, of Rockingham, N.C., said Friday it received approval from the Administrator of the North Carolina Savings Institutions Division to proceed with its plan to convert from a North Carolina-chartered mutual savings bank to a North Carolina-chartered stock savings bank.
Under the plan of conversion, Carolina Fincorp, Inc., Richmond Savings Bank's proposed holding company is offering up to 1,610,000 shares of common stock at $10.00 per share.

Under certain circumstances the number of shares sold could be increased to 1,851,500. Certain of Richmond Savings Bank's depositors and borrowers will be able to purchase stock through a subscription offering that closes on Nov. 5.
